titleStmt.title: The last letters, to the London-merchants and faithful ministers concerning the further proceedings of the conversion and restauration of the Jews with most strange and wonderful miracles performed by the holy captain general of the wandring Israelites, a prophecie touching the downfall of Babylon in 66, and the time of the Gospel to be preach'd throughout the whole world, the number of their great armies, a description of their persons, habits, and weapons, the routing of the King of Arabia, and killing many thousand Turks, and the fearful dream of the Turkish Emperour, worthy of observation by all good Christians.
titleStmt.author: Serrurier, Petrus.

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. 1: The last letters from Dr. Serarias, and the city of Jerusalem, concerning the further proceedings of the Jews, in order to their conversion.

Published again as "The Jewes message to their brethren in Holland", 1665, with the addition of "A new letter sent from Scotland". Most of the text (p. 1, line 7 to p. 6, line 16) is of the same setting in both editions, though the page divisions differ.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
